content.text: Given that \(y = \sin 3x\), find \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\)
Hence find the approximate increase in \(y\) as \(x\) increases from \(\frac{\pi}{9}\) to \(\frac{\pi}{9} + p\), where \(p\) is small
There are 72 members in the club
Every member of the rock-climbing section is also a member of the walking section

An outdoor club has three sections, walking, biking and rock-climbing. Using \(\mathcal{E}\) to denote the set of all members of the club and W, B and R to denote the members of the walking, biking and rock-climbing sections respectively, write each of the following statements using set notation
On the diagram shade the region which represents the set \(X \cup Y'\)
Using set notation express the set \(X \cup Y'\) in an alternative way
Given that \(\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 & 1 \\ - 2 & 5 \end{pmatrix}\), find the inverse of the matrix \(\mathbf{A} + \mathbf{I}\), where \(\mathbf{I}\) is the identity matrix
Hence, or otherwise, find the matrix \(\mathbf{X}\) such that \(\mathbf{A}\mathbf{X} + \mathbf{X} = \mathbf{B}\), where \(\mathbf{B} = \binom{14}{4}\)
Prove that \(\frac{1}{1 - \sin x} - \frac{1}{1 + \sin x} = 2 \tan x \sec x.\)
An acute angle \(x\) is such that \(\sin x = p\). Given that \(\sin 2x = 2\sin x \cos x\), find an expression, in terms of \(p\), for cosec \(2x\)
Given that \(y = x\sqrt{2x + 15}\), show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{k(x + 5)}{\sqrt{2x + 15}}\) , where \(k\) is a constant to be found
Hence find \(\int \frac{x + 5}{\sqrt{2x + 15}} \mathrm{d}x\) and evaluate \(\int_{-3}^{5} \frac{x + 5}{\sqrt{2x + 15}} \mathrm{d}x\)
The line \(y = 3x - 9\) intersects the curve \(49x^{2} - y^{2} + 42x + 8y = 247\) at the points \(A\) and \(B\)
Find the length of the line \(AB\)
Find the velocity of the particle as it passes through \(O\)
Find the acceleration of the particle when \(t = 2\)
Find an expression for the displacement of the particle from \(O\), \(t\mathrm{s}\) after it has passed through \(O\)
A particle moves in a straight line so that, \(t\mathrm{s}\) after passing through a fixed point \(O\), its
\(\nu \mathrm{ms}^{- 1}\), is given by \(\nu = \frac{60}{(3t + 4)^2}\)
Solve \(3^{x} = 200\), giving your answer to 2 decimal places
Solve \(\log_{5}\left(5y + 40\right) - \log_{5}\left(y + 2\right) = 2.\)
Given that \(\frac{(24z^3)^2}{27 \times 12z} = 2^a 3^b z^c\), evaluate \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\)
Solutions to this question by accurate drawing will not be accepted

The diagram shows the quadrilateral \(ABCD\) in which \(A\) is the point (4, 2) and \(B\) is the point \((- 2, - 10)\). The points \(C\) and \(D\) lie on the line \(x = 14\). The diagonal \(AC\) is perpendicular to \(AB\) and passes through the mid-point, \(M\), of the diagonal \(BD\). Find the area of the quadrilateral \(ABCD\)
Express \(18 + 16x - 2x^{2}\) in the form \(a + b(x + c)^{2}\), where \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\) are integers
A function f is defined by \(\mathrm{~f~:~}x\to 18 + 16x - 2x^{2}\) for \(x\in \mathbb{R}\)
Write down the coordinates of the stationary point on the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\)
Sketch the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\)
Find an expression for \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)\)
Solve the equation \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x) = \mathrm{g}(0)\)
A function g is defined by \(\mathrm{~g~:~}x\rightarrow (x + 3)^{2} - 7\) for \(x > - 3.\)
Using an equilateral triangle of side 2 units, find the exact value of \(\sin 60^{\circ}\) and of \(\cos 60^{\circ}\)
\(PQRS\) is a trapezium in which \(PQ = RS = x \text{cm}\) and \(QR = y \text{cm}\)
Angle \(QPS =\) angle \(RSP = 60^{\circ}\) and \(QR\) is parallel to \(PS\)
express \(h\) in terms of \(r\),
show that the external surface area, \(A \mathrm{cm}^2\), of the object is given by
Given that \(r\) can vary,
find the value of \(r\) for which \(A\) has a stationary value,
find this stationary value of \(A\), leaving your answer in terms of \(\pi\),
determine the nature of this stationary value

The diagram shows a solid object in the form of a cylinder of height \(h \mathrm{cm}\) and radius \(r \mathrm{cm}\) on top of a hemisphere of radius \(r \mathrm{cm}\). Given that the volume of the object is \(2880 \pi \mathrm{cm}^3\),
Answer only **one** of the following two alternatives
